{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has a 4-month history of urinary incontinence with an urge to urinate suddenly. He often is unable to make it to the bathroom before leaking urine. There is no incontinence with coughing or laughing, and digital rectal examination shows no abnormalities. Ultrasonography also shows a normal post-void residual volume. This suggests that the patient has urgency urinary incontinence (UUI), which is a common symptom of multiple sclerosis.
